climbs.name: Ain't no Gebronie Touching this Bologna

content.description:
Climb the arête up to a bolt then follow the face past some plates and marginal gear, occasionally stepping left to find some gear in a crack.

Starts on a ledge 3m lower and to the left of the main ledge.
1 bolt, standard rack

From the belay tree, head up a short section of bad rock into a pleasant left facing corner up to a small roof. Step right onto a small ledge and follow the hand crack, topping out on some ledges. 

Variation 5.11a (recommended): At the small roof, move left and climb a different crack which goes from wide hands to fingers before topping out on a ledge.



Located above Lichen Cream Cheese on Lower Dawn. To access, climb Lichen Cream Cheese, then scramble up 4th class terrain past bushes, aiming for a tree near the base of a corner.

Standard rack, tree anchor.

This wide crack is a beast!! You'd have an easier time wrestling a bear. But if you like wide cracks this is a rare find for CL.
Climb up a slab and corner to meet a steep overhang. Traverse 5' left under the overhang and pull into a steep and awkward fist crack. Gain a good horizontal break then wrestle your way into the offwidth/squeeze chimney above.


Located in a kind of obscure section of cliff. To access it, climb Lichen Cream Cheese on Lower Dawn then scramble up on bushy ledges. When you arrive at the next section of cliff, skirt around a blunt arête and continue scrambling a bit higher to a set of rap rings above a small belay ledge.

BD .75 to 5 or 6. doubles in 3 and 4. Tree Anchor

On the left end of the main ledge, climb the two parallel cracks past a protruding block.

left end of the main ledge
standard rack

Climb about 10' up Dynamic Duo then follow the crack that goes diagonally across the face to join Ziggy Piggy.

Starts on Dynamic Duo on the left side of the picnic ledge.
Standard Rack. Same Bolted Anchor of Ziggy Piggy

climbs.name: Moustache
climbs.fa: L. Gallant, D. Caron, M. Theriault 2012

content.description:
You can start in one of two places depending on what you climbed to approach this pitch. 

Option 1 (original): Start on a ledge about 4m down and left of the larger main ledge of Upper Dawn (Can be accessed by climbing the Dyke route or a short rappel from the main ledge). Climb up discontinuous cracks, stepping right into a right facing corner which is level with the main ledge and follow it up to a horizontal crack.

Option 2: Start from the very left side of the main Upper Dawn ledge. Climb up and left on good holds to a horizontal.

Move slightly left in the horizontal and climb up the face and arête, stepping right at the top to finish at the rap rings shared with Dynamic Duo.



Located on the left side of the main face of Upper Dawn.

standard rack

climbs.name: The Ogre
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Michel Martin, Sept. 2020

content.description:
Offwidth climbing without having to use offwidth technique. So Cochrane Laney. Good gear. Good climbing. Nice belay ledge. Linking this with The Dike makes for a nice two pitch climbing.  The unprotected slab above the bolted anchor is Swarmed. 



This route is the obvious corner, crack climb immediately left of Ain't No Gebronie. 

Standard rack to 3" piece. Bolted rappel station. Rap the route.

climbs.name: Procol Harum
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Kate Trecartin, May 2019

content.description:
A very nice variation. Start up Whiter Shade of Pale. After reaching the top of the steep section (about 40 feet) traverse left and climb a crack system that leads to a slightly overhanging finish. Great gear throughout. Incredible rock features. 

Found on the large Upper Dawn ledge.
Single rack to 3" piece. Tree anchor. Rappel from rings close by or the tree.

Climb the thin, flaring crack and face holds left of the corner of Whiter Shade of Pale.

This route doesn't have an anchor so either build a gear anchor at the top of the crack (multiple gear options) or traverse left about 3m to the Ziggy Piggy anchor.



doubles in small cam sizes. Mid sized cams for the gear anchor

Climb the corner to gain the slab above. Up the slab and into an overhanging dihedral. Finish at a large tree.
This route is sandbagged.

On the right side of the main ledge.
standard rack

Variation linking Ziggy Piggy into Dynamic Duo.
Climb the entire crux of Ziggy Piggy to a good rest. Traverse left past a vertical crack with a piton. Thin moves to gain a good horizontal then finish up Dynamic Duo.

Start up Ziggy Piggy near the middle of the lunch ledge.
Standard rack to BD #2 or #3. one piton. tree anchor

Climb the crack that zig-zags part way up. Classic Cochrane Lane crack climb.

middle of the main ledge
standard rack
This wall is located above Lower Dawn. Routes start from a large comfortable ledge. This wall hosts a few classic trad climbs including the classic testpiece Ziggy Piggy.
